intro: Christmannia courondii, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Christmannia courondii is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a perennial herb.
